channels: position: vertical or horizontal length, optionally: color
summary: Bar charts use horizontal or vertical bars to display data that is correlated with x and y axis labels.

Chord diagrams are used to display relationships of data in matrix form. The outside circle is labelled with groupings, called nodes, that are then in turn connected by arcs, or arc connections. The arcs more readable than straight lines would be and are created with Bezier curves. The thickness of these arcs is correlated with the values of the connection it represents. Color is often used to show the directionality of the data.
analysis: A seasoned data visualization consumer understands the significance of color,positioning, arc size and groupings within a chord diagram. Any less-informed individual would be easily confused with the amount of data being presented.
